Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Grand Style, pottery chalice; creamy slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of a palmette and lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: at rim, band of billets alternating with dotted blanks above band of short oblique strokes between lines; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Lemos identifies the sherd as belonging to a Black Figure Komast chalice. There is no evidence for black-figure decoration. Similar rim patterns are found on Grand Style vases. The rim pattern is carelessly executed.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 328, no. 1529)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0737) (phase 2)
